etymology.description: May have originally been the same character as 巳, depicting a snake or a fetus.
etymology.interpretation: The character 已(yǐ, "already") may have shared its origins with 巳(sì, "sixth Earthly Branch"), as both originally depicted a snake or a fetus. Although not found in the Shuowen Jiezi, it has evolved to represent the concept of 'already' in modern usage.

examples.chinese: 我已完成作业(我已完成作業)。
examples.english: I have already completed my homework.

examples.chinese: 他已到达机场(他已到達機場)，航班即将起飞(航班即將起飛)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐ dàodá jīchǎng, hángbān jíjiāng qǐfēi.
examples.english: He has already arrived at the airport, and the flight will take off soon.
